<hisroty> Mike said that :As a witness, I can provide the plaintiff's company ID card and work sign-in records during their employment, which will serve as evidence of their association with the defendant's company.Alex said that :Based on the plaintiff's oral agreement and the supporting evidence, we can argue that the plaintiff was indeed an employee of the defendant's company and is entitled to the promised salary. We can also challenge the defendant's claim that the plaintiff was only an intern and part-time employee by highlighting the duration of their employment and the nature of their work. We should also challenge the defendant's claim that the plaintiff was only an intern and part-time employee.

message.content: The plaintiff's company ID card and work sign-in records will serve as evidence of their association with the defendant's company. The plaintiff's oral agreement, supporting evidence, and witness testimony can be used to argue that they were an employee entitled to the promised salary. The duration of their employment and the nature of their work should be emphasized, along with the importance of honoring oral agreements and the legal obligations of employers.
